revised_title: Ground-state Splitting and Optical Absorption Spectrum for Mn Ions in a Cubic Field
tldr: The authors calculated the ground-state splitting and optical absorption spectrum for Mn ions in a cubic field using the crystal field approximation and a complete configuration. They found that the observed ground-state splitting for Mn can only be accounted for by this model if the Racah parameter A is about 30% larger than the observed value for Fe in a similar crystal environment. The study provides insights into the relationship between the ground-state splitting and optical absorption spectrum of Mn ions in cubic host crystals.
